intro: Elaphrium goldmanii, commonly known as the golden elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its delicate, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
